Hi @Dana Mahdi <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> , 

Please find attached the added comment from RF team for the process agreement.

 

As discussed, MUSE in partnership with Group Ops will be handling the goods on behalf of the reseller and Reflaunt will be paying MUSE for the service. Therefore, we are responsible for these goods. Can we ammend the agreement with right approach for this please.

 

Thanks,

Rijal

			Dear Nick and Rijal,
			
			During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

			*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
			*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

			
			Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

			
			Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
			Sofia

				Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

				 

				We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

				The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

				 

				Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

				We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. 				In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

				 

				We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

				 

				In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

				Dear Nick and Rijal,
				
				During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

				*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
				*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in.

the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

				
				Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

				
				Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
				Sofia

				On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 10:35 AM Nick Vinckier <Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com> > wrote:

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization.

Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

We're looking for efficency at this stage, even if this means compromising on the seller expereince. Given also the local delivery is potentially applied to certain items only, can you please share a final cost table structure specifically indicating single cost line by line? Also this means for a local order we're looking at pick&pack $4.50+delivery $5 = $9.5 per order, which is extremly high. We will consider this as part of the business case when we get more indication on the volumes, but these cost will be reflected in the structure of the payout to seller eventually, meaning we will not be able to guarantee the same payout level as we have for level, for example. 
					*	Pick & pack =$ 4.5 is Outbound handling cost (incl. manual order creation, pick & pack per pc, standard box packaging). There is no manual order creation, as dicussed the order will be placed via carryio integration. Can you please share the updated cost reflecting this? 

					 

					I hope the above is clear and we can come to an agreement soon to move forward to the next steps.

I hope the above is clear and we can come to an agreement soon to move forward to the next steps.

				Dear Nick and Rijal,
				
				During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

				*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
				*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

				
				Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

				
				Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
				Sofia

				On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 10:35 AM Nick Vinckier <Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com> > wrote:

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Hi Anna, 
					
					Apologies for the late response.

					 

					Our business case has taken into consideration min. 3 items = approx. 3,285 items to be collected in Y1 (This includes RTW). Also considering that based on your input it is 2 RTW & 1 other category expected.

					 

					If we rule out RTW category and min. 3 items, this will impact the business case as we’re looking for volume here.

					 

					As for the outbound handling cost, RF custom development in the panel does not track all inventory management internally since it is not connected to OMS. The manual order creation is creating a work order for the WH team to fulfill the orders to which is also related to stock tracking, the setup with RF is just a generation of AWB with Carriyo -> DHL and notification that there is an order.

					 

					Without a next day delivery, it’ll cost $2.04 per item but I think this would affect the overall experience as a reseller

					 

					I hope that clarifies. Again if we need to jump on a call today, Let me know. I have a meeting with Ops team again on Monday and could raise the concerns.

				Dear Nick and Rijal,
				
				During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

				*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
				*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

				
				Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

				
				Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
				Sofia

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Indeed this will be with Group Ops as they are ready to onboard the project with this proposal and it is more scalable with them to onboard more categories and onboard other brands who would use the program.
					
					To answer your questions:

					*	In terms of brand list or categories, this is something we can discuss together that suits the business model. 					*	Pick up cost is $7.5 per collection since we have the rule of min. 3 items we calculated per item = $2.5. This includes handling item at collection + next day pick up option for reseller. We're looking for efficency at this stage, even if this means compromising on the seller expereince. Given also the local delivery is potentially applied to certain items only, can you please share a final cost table structure specifically indicating single cost line by line? Also this means for a local order we're looking at pick&pack $4.50+delivery $5 = $9.5 per order, which is extremly high. We will consider this as part of the business case when we get more indication on the volumes, but these cost will be reflected in the structure of the payout to seller eventually, meaning we will not be able to guarantee the same payout level as we have for level, for example. 
					*	Pick & pack =$ 4.5 is Outbound handling cost (incl. manual order creation, pick & pack per pc, standard box packaging). There is no manual order creation, as dicussed the order will be placed via carryio integration. Can you please share the updated cost reflecting this?

				Dear Nick and Rijal,
				
				During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

				*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
				*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

				
				Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

				
				Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
				Sofia

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Hi Anna,

					Indeed this will be with Group Ops as they are ready to onboard the project with this proposal and it is more scalable with them to onboard more categories and onboard other brands who would use the program.
					
					To answer your questions:

					*	In terms of brand list or categories, this is something we can discuss together that suits the business model. This means we might also change and exclude the min 3 items rule until we include other categories and expand the brand list.

This means we might also change and exclude the min 3 items rule until we include other categories and expand the brand list.
					*	Pick up cost is $7.5 per collection since we have the rule of min. 3 items we calculated per item = $2.5. This includes handling item at collection + next day pick up option for reseller. We're looking for efficency at this stage, even if this means compromising on the seller expereince. Given also the local delivery is potentially applied to certain items only, can you please share a final cost table structure specifically indicating single cost line by line? Also this means for a local order we're looking at pick&pack $4.50+delivery $5 = $9.5 per order, which is extremly high. We will consider this as part of the business case when we get more indication on the volumes, but these cost will be reflected in the structure of the payout to seller eventually, meaning we will not be able to guarantee the same payout level as we have for level, for example. 
					*	Pick & pack =$ 4.5 is Outbound handling cost (incl. manual order creation, pick & pack per pc, standard box packaging). There is no manual order creation, as dicussed the order will be placed via carryio integration. Can you please share the updated cost reflecting this?

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
					Sofia

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Hi Rijal,

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
					Sofia

					On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 10:35 AM Nick Vinckier <Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com> > wrote:

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					*	Pick & pack =$ 4.5 is Outbound handling cost (incl. manual order creation, pick & pack per pc, standard box packaging). There is no manual order creation, as dicussed the order will be placed via carryio integration. Can you please share the updated cost reflecting this?

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
					Sofia

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
					Sofia

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. 					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					Dear Nick and Rijal,
					
					During the many months of discussions and back and forth negotiations for the MUSE resale program, we put forward our best offer based on our estimated operational costs, which we specified in all documentation provided. While it is great news that Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on.

Chalhoub Group is keen to offer a recommerce operational service to Reflaunt for the fulfilment of the MUSE resale service, the costs are significantly higher than what we based the MUSE proposal on. I have outlined below our proposed solution to proceed with the service without incurring a loss for either side, hoping you will find it agreeable. We remain confident that the quality of our service and return on investment is the most competitive in the market.

					*	If RTW is a critical element for Chalhoub/MUSE, we can include it in the service scope but we retain control over the list of accepted brands and sub-categories that meet our criteria for resale value and sell-through. This is in line with our approach for all resale partners and regions. It is not in our interest to overly restrict the breadth of inventory that customers can send in, but we will need to protect Reflaunt's downside in case of low margins or slow sales, considering that Level Shoes is not willing to sell RTW so we would rely solely on Reflaunt's network.
					*	We do need your collaboration on the storage costs though. The flat $0.93 per item per month adds almost 10% to the unit cost of each item for every month in the warehouse, which is not sustainable given the seasonal nature of RTW and the fact that we do not want to overly restrict what customers can send in. We ask that we keep this at our originally proposed $0.25 per item per month at least for the first year, after which we can review the end-to-end business case for everyone.

					
					Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE?

Finally, can you confirm the local fulfillment solution is applicable both in the case that items sell on Level Shoes and on any other destination in the UAE? As mentioned previously, we are in discussion with new partners to increase sell-through locally, so we want to make sure the operational partnership can cover this.

					
					Thank you, and have a lovely weekend,
					Sofia

					On Fri, Nov 8, 2024 at 10:35 AM Nick Vinckier <Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com <mailto:Nick.Vinckier@chalhoub.com> > wrote:

					Hi Anna, allow me to jump in as it's essential for us to include RTW.

					 

					We don't want to merely launch another platform to source luxury bags & shoes in the UAE, as this would only function as a competitor to Level Shoes.

					The point of reMUSE is to offer a complimentary service to Level Shoes' in the region, not cannibalize.

					 

					Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns.

Additionally, a reduction in volume would turn the business case most likely unfeasible for us as the upfront investment might not justify the returns. 

					 

					We can discuss this over a call if easier, but we'd like to understand if and how we can proceed. 

					 

					If not possible for you, please let us know as soon as possible so we can re-open the conversation with other resale as a service partners. 

					 

					We consider reMUSE (incl. RTW) as a must for our Group. We might be able to nibble off some costs left or right with our Ops team (approx. $1 improvement) but we won't be able to cater to your initial counter proposal as the cost structure in the Middle East is different to what you might be used to in other parts of the world. 

					 

					In case you can find another partner who can do it at more affordable prices, please put us in touch with them as we are currently proposing you our rates at cost.

					 

					We reached out to DHL, Aramex and Quiqup ourselves and none of them are even able to provide the services in the region.

					 

					In case you want to deliver the items yourself locally with an other courier, we're fine with that as well.

					 

					Ideally, we can regroup after 6 months and explore areas of optimization. If the volumes allow, I can make the business case of hiring dedicated people for resale operations, which could bring down the cost further. However, we cannot bear that risk from Day 1 without proof of concept.

					 

					Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers.

Finally, we do want to make it work as this would mean you can offer this local service to any of your customers. I've seen that Dubai is already one of your most popular cities when it comes to resale, with Level Shoes alone. I'm sure the potential is huge to offer this to your other customers.

					 

					That said, we have to respect the rates we're giving from our Ops team at this stage.

					 

					Hope you understand / look forward to discussing this with you and find a solution.

					 

					Best regards,

					Nick

					*	In terms of brand list or categories, this is something we can discuss together that suits the business model. 					*	Pick up cost is $7.5 per collection since we have the rule of min. 3 items we calculated per item = $2.5. This includes handling item at collection + next day pick up option for reseller.
